</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value>  </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the [[Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID | machine network ID]] of the client that initiated [[Remote Execution]]. If used in SP or outside of remote executed context, the command returns 0.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> To check if the context is remote executed, use [[isRemoteExecuted]] or [[isRemoteExecutedJIP]].</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[remoteExecutedOwner]] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_callerRE = [[remoteExecutedOwner]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Send request to the server and get immediate response:
<code>{
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>in this scope, the remoteExecutedOwner equals clientOwner of the sender</value></part></template>
	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>so using it as target in remoteExec will send response right back at him</value></part></template>
	[
		[[time]], <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>mission time value on the server</value></part></template>
		{
			[[hint]] [[format]]
			[
				"Request recieved!\nMission time value on the server is: %1",
				[[_this]]
			];
		}
	]
	[[remoteExec]] ["call", [[remoteExecutedOwner]]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>server response to the sender</value></part></template>
} 
[[remoteExec]] ["call", 2]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>send request to server</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[isRemoteExecuted]], [[isRemoteExecutedJIP]], [[remoteExec]], [[remoteExecCall]], [[canSuspend]], [[publicVariableClient]], [[admin]], [[owner]], [[clientOwner]], [[groupOwner]], [[didJIPOwner]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Arma 3: Remote Execution]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 11, 2017 - 09:31 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Demellion|Demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''NOTE''': Always be sure to check if the [[remoteExecutedOwner]] is not equal to 0 when sending a [[remoteExec]]/[[remoteExecCall]] packet back, as this will result in sending packet to ANYONE (0):
<code>[[if]] ([[remoteExecutedOwner]] [[isEqualTo]] 0) [[exitWith]] {}; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>invalid RE owner</value></part></template>
_gearArray [[remoteExecCall]] ['someGearFunction', [[remoteExecutedOwner]]];</code>
Will prevent from code being accidentally sent to everyone on the server.
</dd>
</dl>
